tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Devoted dad Danny wants to build a sustainable but affordable house with bedroom pods on stilts up among the trees. But with no self-build experience and spiralling costs, can he do it on ambition alone?

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Millie Ross and Costa Georgiadis learn how to read the plants in Kakadu, Jane Edmanson admires some winter magnolias, Josh Byrne shows how to keep your vegie patch productive, and Tino Carnevale gets some tips on grafting.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: Amateur musicians take to pianos in train stations while being secretly watched by performers, Lang Lang and Mika. Who will they choose to play at the Royal Festival Hall? Their search begins in Kings Cross St Pancras.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: When Mel and Jack buy a derelict old Queenslander for $21,000 and move it to their land in Noosa it seems theyve scored the bargain of the century, or at least a century old bargain!

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Paula Stillie has always looked different from her white adoptive family and is on a quest to discover her identity. Meanwhile, Lisa is on a mission to find her older sister who was given up for adoption before Lisa was born.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Graeme and Melanie want their new home in Hackney to celebrate their blended family. But squeezing the bright red-clad house Graeme has designed, complete with a basement, onto their tiny garage plot proves a huge challenge.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Sophie Thomson gets a master class in pruning wisteria, Jane Edmanson pots up winter-flowering natives, Costa Georgiadis meets an urban farmer, Millie Ross plants a berry patch and Tino Carnevale makes a propagation unit.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based On Lies
programme.desc: Cheryl and Alice eventually join forces but after Cheryls livelihood and life is threatened, they discover that in order to really challenge Rob, they will have to stop playing by the rules. (Final)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Builder Nick is hoping to build his wife Rachel the ultimate house in the idyllic Blue Mountains; a place that for the first time in her life, she can finally call home.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Grow Peonies and Summer Veg
programme.desc: Costa joins anniversary celebrations at Kings Park and Botanic Garden, Millie visits a peony farm, Josh plants summer crops, Sophie suggests perennials for dry climates, and we meet a doctor with a tropical plant obsession.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Raise your glasses to another classic episode of Hard Quiz! Chasing the Big Brass Mug in this episode are Stray Kids fan Jacqui, Arsenal Football Club devotee Shuban, Avatar buff Jonathan, and Australian megabats expert Lisa.

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Its story time on Spicks with Justine Clarke. Theres a bear in there and people as well, with Alan, Myf and Adam joined by Miss Kaninna, Tommy Little, Don West, Geraldine Hickey and a stunning performance by Montaigne.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Digimon Survive And Overcooked Irl Challenge!
programme.desc: We try to survive the digital monster filled visual novel and tactical role-playing mash-up, Digimon Survive! Plus, we cook up a storm in a delicious challenge of real life Overcooked!

programme.title: Miraculous World: Shanghai, Lady Dragon
programme.desc: On the occasion of a school break, Marinette heads to Shanghai to meet Adrien... and discover her own origins.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When Bitzer injures his foot and cant work, the Farmer chooses the pigs to take over his role!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Can you lift a car with a ponytail? The doctors put the strength of human hair to the test and find out what makes different colours and types of hair.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: The staff at the Columbus Zoo prepare to make a home for an orphaned baby gorilla.

programme.title: The Mysterious Benedict Society
programme.desc: The kids enlist an ally. Constance faces off with an old enemy. Number Two confronts Dr. Curtain.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand have brought their lab into Xands kitchen! In todays episode, the doctors look at mucus, and show you an experiment to test the power of snot.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: This week we head into the verse to check out the all-out battle royale brawl in Rumbleverse, and the colliding worlds and fists of Multiversus where Bugs Bunny can fight Batman!

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: In honour of Fathers Day, Horrible Histories takes a look at some of historys daftest dads, featuring Henry VIII, Charles Dickens, William the Conqueror and Joseph Stalin!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Distracted Detective
programme.desc: Ezra is nominated for the Young Small Business Awards but as the event draws near, Ezra is increasingly upset and Maudie must find out why.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kais friends try to cheer him up.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: While trying to retrieve his ball, Bitzer falls into a muddy pond. When Shaun sees a big, blobby, shambling thing squelching across the field hes convinced they are being attacked by a swamp monster...run!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi help find a runaway droid.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The challenge is even tougher as the House Robots have been let off the leash in a new twist... Rogue House Robot. This second heat includes Cherub, PP3D, Draven, Push To Exit, Hobgoblin, Behemoth, Cobra and Eruption.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: We meet some cute skipping dogs, a phenomenal scooter rider and some of the worlds heaviest sportspeople. A stuntwoman shows off her sensational scorpion kicks, and theres a very large pet.

programme.title: Documentary Now!
programme.desc: In 1980, a cult descended on the small town of Chinook, Oregon, sparking a feud with residents.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Its the day of Addies performance, but theres even more drama behind the scenes as Emilys jealousy reaches breaking point. With Maggie in prison, Elinor plans a daring rescue.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Vegeta Disappears?! Menace Of The Duplicate Vegeta!
programme.desc: After being drained of his energy, Vegeta and the others escape and learn more about the Superhuman Water. And if they dont stop the clones, Vegeta could disappear - for good.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: In this two-part episode, Oscar attends a gathering of Odd Squad scientists called Lab-Con at Odd Squad Academy.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Gwen tries to convince Chef to tell the class the truth about their pet goldfish.

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: An Autobot starship crash lands on Earth! The Autobots and Maltos must get there first to protect it - and whomever is inside - from the Decepticons...

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Robin gets amnesia and starts thinking that Hawkman is his mother.

programme.title: Wordsville
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Too Energetic Town
programme.desc: The word LETHARGIC has been taken from Reporter Reads word of the day calendar and everyone in Wordsville has become so energetic that theyre hyper!

programme.title: Know It Alls: History
programme.desc: Comedian Carlo Ritchie and youngster Evans embark on a fact-finding mission through the Hyde Park Barracks of Sydney to learn about the convicts of New South Wales.

programme.title: The Ancient World Greece
programme.desc: The ancient Greeks were adventurers, always looking towards new lands and fresh challenges. During the Archaic and Hellenistic periods, the ancient Greeks formed new colonies from Spain to Sri Lanka.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil visits the Welsh capital of Cardiff and a 1940s bachelor pad thats a bacteria fest of unclean surfaces, grimy floors and manky carpets.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Ross argues with Greene about how best to care for dying AIDS patient, Chia-Chia. Benton treats an injured woman who refuses to press charges against her abusive policeman husband. The staff celebrates Weavers day off.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Paul is battling Muscular Dystrophy to save a Victorian Circus Wagon, a grain store is re-imagined as a festival bar and George discovers a hotel that is disguised as a tree and a camping pod that looks like a giant conker.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: The longest government shutdown in US history looks set to end, but not everyones happy. Chas and John discuss the fallout and last weeks election backlash against Trump. Plus former Speaker Nancy Pelosi retires.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Mark faces an ethical dilemma when deciding whether to report yet another of Doug Ross indiscretions when he learns that Doug slept with med student, Harper Tracy. Jeanie begins work in the ER as a physicians assistant.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael succeeds in getting the family on The Weakest Link, but Anne Robinson is about to raise more difficult questions than expected.

programme.title: Live At The Apollo
programme.sub-title: Ardal Ohanlon, Mawaan Rizwan, Sara Barron
programme.desc: Ardal OHanlon hosts Live at the Apollo alongside British-based American comedian Sara Barron and Mawaan Rizwan.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Keedie is in burnout after the drama at school. Can Addie help her and find out what happened in Miss Murphys office all those years ago. Can Frank and Nina find a lost tortoise?

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Goku Vs. The Duplicate Vegeta! Which One Is Going To Win?!
programme.desc: As Vegeta begins to disappear, Goku faces the duplicate Vegeta! But can he defeat the copy and save the original before he vanishes? And when the fight starts, is Vegeta rooting for... his clone?

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: In this two-part episode, Oscar attends a gathering of Odd Squad scientists called Lab-Con at Odd Squad Academy.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: When Owen hides a walkie talky inside his chili dog, Harold believes its an alien here to destroy Earth.

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: The Maltos enjoy a snow day while, back at Base, something has the Autobots in a red-hot rage... When Twitch gets caught in their frenzy - can she survive long enough to help her troubled friends?

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Its Titans West vs. Titans East as the two teams compete for who gets Bumblebee.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Learn what a mandala is, how to design one and how to make a pinhole lantern.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phils latest secret assignment takes him to Watford and the four-bed detached house of John and Mirasol Lockwood, and Emma Green and Steve Wright and their dog Bruno.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Mark faces an ethical dilemma when deciding whether to report yet another of Doug Ross indiscretions when he learns that Doug slept with med student, Harper Tracy. Jeanie begins work in the ER as a physicians assistant.

programme.title: Outbreak
programme.desc: The Motaba virus inflicts a swift, horrible death, and only one man can stop it from spreading into a deadly worldwide outbreak in this riveting scientific thriller.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy is the best at kicking the ball. Igglepiggle finds it harder so she kindly teaches him.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: All of Jangos friends are too busy to play so he tricks them into stopping work, but Jangos tricks create even more work for his friends.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Prince Wednesday Gives Away His Book
programme.desc: The Royal Family donates used books to the Neighbourhood library so that Daniel and the other neighbours can enjoy them as well. Later, Daniel chooses to give away his special binoculars to Prince Wednesday.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Pedro gets a cough at playschool and the other children quickly catch it. Doctor Brownbear is called and gives them horrible medicine, but who will look after him when he is ill?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Battle ensues when the pigs muscle in on Shauns private club and steal all the pizza. Shaun, Bitzer and the flock mount a rescue mission for Timmy who the pigs have taken hostage.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Romeo want to steals ultimate Ice Power from iceworld.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: For an entire day the Kingdom has to make do without help from magic.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is the end of the holiday and Peppa is sad. George rides on his potato whilst Peppa tries out another (differently themed) splash pool.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: On Spykes last day at Kangaroo Beach, the cadets build an epic landcastle by the lake to give her a send-off shell never forget.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard go paddleboarding, but Dunk and the river creatures are behaving very strangely. Could it be something to do with Dads desire for a cup of tea?

programme.title: Play School: Let The Music Play
programme.desc: Leah and Teo are joined by musician Holly in the Play School Sound Studio to explore beats and percussion. The toys band together to perform in the Play School Sound Studio Jam!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Its the Twins birthdays and the Dream Factory Crew is determined to surprise Drew and Jonathan with their own special gifts - but can they keep the secret from both brothers at the same time?!

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Alien Elephants
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay find a tiny elephant, they have very different ideas about what to do with it; Jay wants it to play alien spaceships and Nikhil wants it to go into his museum.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The sounds in a Wildlife Park are extreme, which gives the Sound Collector a noisy idea!

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Cuddlestown holds a competition for the best jam and the Bananas find themselves having to be the judges.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Explore musical dynamics with The Wiggles! Join with Evie as she teaches Captain Feathersword about the importance of volume and tone.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its school project time for Peppa and her friends which means they have to build castles and bring them into playgroup!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: A Mandarinteryx has moved into homebase and is causing a big mess. In order to move it along, they have to find it a partner, and quickly.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Zigzags ADHD gives her a case of the hops, Vida teaches her how to make a to-do list.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Long Armed Squid
programme.desc: Peso and Kwazii venture down to the midnight zone to help a hurt creature, but what they find is a shipwreck haunted by a spooky-looking long armed squid.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Catboy wants to increase his speed... but in doing so, drains power from his friends.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When a Railway Show for little engines comes to Sodor, an overly excited Percy finally sees his chance to shine.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the Green Team have a scavenger hunt in a rainforest, stopping along the way to learn about the amazing eco system and the animals and plants that live there.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come along and join the Wiggly fun, count to twenty with Caterina, and then dive into some creative craft fun as you discover whats in the craft box today!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig has finally finished writing her first book and decides to take it to playgroup to read to the children with unexpected results.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Millie builds a little lending library for her friends and her community.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets compete in a series of lifeguard challenges, but Frizzy is distracted by the promise of shiny gold medals.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko wont help Octobella when her shrimp rebels. In fact he makes it worse.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Can Sofia make Windsor Gardens biggest ever omelette? Only if Paddington can replace some cracked eggs in time.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: There is a new fox cub leader in The Little Kingdom. Its Nanny Plum, also known as Fluffy Owl. Whilst attempting to earn their adventure badges the fox cubs find themselves stuck at the top of Mount Everest with no way down.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: When a wormhole opens in Tree House Mission Command, Chip walks through into an Alien World across the Galaxy and returns with a six-legged alien bunny. With the wormhole closed, how will they get this strange bunny home?

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipine children are nowhere to be found and the Tombliboos toothbrushes just wont stay put.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Ziggy orders a special magic coat so that he can learn a new trick. The magic coat works and Ziggy makes his friends things disappear, but he cannot make them re-appear.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel really wants to go outside and play in the snow, but its too early in the morning. Dad Tiger shows Daniel that hes big enough now to wait in bed until its time to get up.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig has a book from the library that he has kept for too long. The family go to the library to return it and find more books to read.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Timmy decides to help the hedgehogs find a resting place for the night. His efforts, however, lead his weary friends into a series of scrapes rather than giving them a good nights sleep.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Romeo has stolen the Ice Crystal... And Icecub lose his Powers!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum and the Wise Old Elf compete to build a boat that will beat the Marigolds.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go to Granny and Grandpa Pigs house, where Grandpa Pig introduces his robot to them.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger teaches the baby Pea-Rexes a new survival skill through a game of hide and seek but things get out of hand when Split goes missing!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When Big Lizard and Cosima get covered in nectar they become unwilling house guests to some over-friendly beetles. Could Dunk come to their rescue?

programme.title: Play School: Let The Music Play
programme.desc: Matt and Takaya are joined by special guests Peter the pianist, Roy who plays the guitar and Clare who plays the accordion! They have a dress up dance party and get down to the groove before busking with the toys.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew are preparing to earn their Neighbourhood Helper badge when Jonathan takes a tumble and has to use a wheelchair for a few days.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Monsooooooon!
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay want to be in the monsoon rain. But its not raining...and they dont just want rain, rain, they want MONSOON rain, like their Chennai Grandparents have.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector discovers a bee in the garden. But how will he get it flying again?

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Rat dreams of a world where everything is made of cheese but when his dream seems to come true, he starts to have second thoughts.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join Lachy and Simon for some rhyming fun, then Do the Propeller with The Wiggles as we explore planes and sing along!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig has finally finished writing her first book and decides to take it to playgroup to read to the children with unexpected results.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes get caught in the middle of out of control rolling Coconutdons and tail swatting Pineapplesaurus.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Tidbit gets a mosquito bite on picture day, he doesnt want a photo... until Vida has an idea!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Manta Rays
programme.desc: The Octonauts help a young manta ray find the secret manta ray feeding grounds, but when they finally locate it, the Octonauts become caught in the middle of a dangerous feeding frenzy!

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Munki-gu enchants a Dragon Float, turning it into a menace. An Yu tries to help the PJ Masks put this right, but thinks she cant because her powers dont work in the city.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In Brazil, Thomas meets two wood-burning engines whove never travelled beyond their eucalyptus railway. Thomas agrees to swap jobs with them for the day, but this causes more trouble than he expects.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: You need only your imagination to have fun in a garden. The kids are assigned a list of garden tasks to receive clues and riddles to get to the next stage. From identifying plants to making compost tea, this is a magical exploration with Hannah.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come and learn all about families, big and small, and meet The Wiggles loved ones! With groovy moves and catchy tunes like Double Happy - The Twins Song - its a singing and dancing celebration for the whole family!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle takes the children on a trip to the Zoo where they get a tour from the zookeepers: Mr Lion, Mrs Crocodile and Mr Giraffe!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Searching for a vital part of the ship lost during their crash landing, Cosima and Big Lizard find Dunk stuck on a beach. They use science to save the day and make a new friend.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets help Neville overcome a bad case of the wobblies before competing in the Battle of the Boards swimming challenge.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Amayas friends Marie and Jennie get entranced and imperilled by Luna Girl.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington wishes he could have been at Mr. and Mrs. Browns wedding after seeing some photos, so they decide to do it all again!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.sub-title: Nanny Plumb And The Wise Old Elf Swap Jobs For One Whole Day
programme.desc: Nanny Plum believes she works harder than The Wise Old Elf. The Wise Old Elf believes he works harder than Nanny Plum! King Thistle commands them to swap jobs for the day to settle the argument.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the kids explore the area of La Perouse, next to Botany Bay, looking for the endangered Eastern Suburbs Banksia Scrub. Our team will extract the seeds from Banksia cones with fire and plant the seeds.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Devoted dad Danny wants to build a sustainable but affordable house with bedroom pods on stilts up among the trees. But with no self-build experience and spiralling costs, can he do it on ambition alone?

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Rafael Bonachela, the artistic director of Sydney Dance Company says he was born to dance: but while that love took him to the top of contemporary dance, it splintered his family: now comes the dance to reconcile that.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show
programme.desc: Its the season finale of That Pacific Sports Show! Tiana Penitani Gray, Sam Wykes, Sera Naiqama and Tinirau Arona wrap up 2025 with highlights, special guests, and powerful Pasifika performances. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: The ABS will release unemployment figures for October. In September, the jobless rate unexpectedly jumped from 4.3% to 4.5%. We look at how the October data could affect the next interest rates decision in December.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.sub-title: The women are coming - and they might ruin everything
programme.desc: Julia Baird and guest host Chas Licciardello chat about an article in the New York Times "Are women ruining the workplace?". Plus what do the resignations at the BBC tell us about the state of the media and power?

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

programme.title: ABC News Hour

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: When you need to know whats going on across the country and around the globe, turn to Joe OBrien for a comprehensive roundup of the days news plus original reporting on the issues that affect you.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Manny Tsigas brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Alicia Barry presents a weekly roundup of business, finance and economic news including the latest trends on Australian and overseas markets, analysing whats going on in the local and global economy and how it affects you.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Catherine Murphy, Charles Brice and Nate Byrne hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.
